assessments.task_description: 15% is awarded for participation, and includes: seminar attendance, contribution to group discussions, and engagement with extracurricular learning activities.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Gobbets are short passages or extracts from primary texts that students must analyse and write a 350-word commentary on. A maximum of 20 marks (5 per gobbet) will be awarded for a total of four gobbet exercises. Students must choose and submit four gobbet analyses from the 10 options provided on Blackboard under the relevant week. Please be aware that this assessment task is designed to evaluate students’ abilities, skills, and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Gobbets must be submitted through Turnitin during seminar weeks.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Each student is required to submit a 6-minute video essay that focusses on one of 8 possible works of visual art from the Middle Ages or Renaissance. The eight options will be available on Blackboard. Students must use form-appropriate methods of analysis to explain the religious meaning and intellectual, cultural and/or social significance of the artwork to the Jewish and/or Christian culture of the time of its composition.

You may use AI to assist in the development of this assessment item; however, a visual and audio recording of you speaking must be present for the duration of your video. A statement indicating where AI has been used must be included at the end of the video or below your Works Cited.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Video Essays must be uploaded to the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This examination will be comprised of two equally weighted sections: in the first section, you must analyse 2 gobbet passages from a total of 5 options. All gobbet passages will be derived from the books studied in this course. In the second section, you must write an essay in response 1 of the 5 prompts. Each of the 5 prompts will relate to one of the books studied in this course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Ancient Judaism

This lecture will explore the origins, history, and founding stories of Judaism from the 2nd millennium BCE to the destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Ancient Judaism This lecture will explore the origins, history, and founding stories of Judaism from the 2nd millennium BCE to the destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE.

learning_activities.topic:
The Pentateuch: Genesis

In this tutorial, students will explore the primeval history of divine creation in the first book of the Pentateuch, as well as the ancestral history of Abraham's covenant with God, and discuss the significance of Genesis for Western thought and culture.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The Pentateuch: Genesis In this tutorial, students will explore the primeval history of divine creation in the first book of the Pentateuch, as well as the ancestral history of Abraham's covenant with God, and discuss the significance of Genesis for Western thought and culture.

learning_activities.topic:
Rabbinic Judaism

This lecture will examine the history of Rabbinic Judaism from the destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE to the early Middle Ages.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Rabbinic Judaism This lecture will examine the history of Rabbinic Judaism from the destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE to the early Middle Ages.

learning_activities.topic:
The Ketuvim: The Book of Job

In this tutorial, students will read The Book of Job, exploring its major theme of theodicy - the problem of human suffering and divine justice in the world - and discuss its significance for Western thought and culture.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The Ketuvim: The Book of Job In this tutorial, students will read The Book of Job, exploring its major theme of theodicy - the problem of human suffering and divine justice in the world - and discuss its significance for Western thought and culture.

learning_activities.topic:
Historical Jesus

This lecture will explore the origins, history, and stories of Christianity from the birth of Jesus to the composition of the Gospels.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Historical Jesus This lecture will explore the origins, history, and stories of Christianity from the birth of Jesus to the composition of the Gospels.

learning_activities.topic:
The New Testament: The Gospel of Matthew

In this tutorial, students will read the Gospel of Matthew, compare the canonical text to the gnostic Infancy Gospel of Thomas, and discuss questions about the authorship and canonicity of the Gospels.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: The New Testament: The Gospel of Matthew
learning_activities.topic_description: The New Testament: The Gospel of Matthew In this tutorial, students will read the Gospel of Matthew, compare the canonical text to the gnostic Infancy Gospel of Thomas, and discuss questions about the authorship and canonicity of the Gospels.

learning_activities.topic:
Church & Empire

This lecture will explore the emergence of a catholic form of Christianity in the first four centuries CE, along with the growth of churches in the Mediterranean and Christianity's fateful alliance with the Roman Empire in 312 CE.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Church & Empire This lecture will explore the emergence of a catholic form of Christianity in the first four centuries CE, along with the growth of churches in the Mediterranean and Christianity's fateful alliance with the Roman Empire in 312 CE.

learning_activities.topic:
Anonymous: Beowulf

In this tutorial, students will read the Old English epic poem Beowulf, the only surviving manuscript of which was thought to have been composed between c. 975-1025 CE. Attention will be paid to the way that this pagan oral narrative was Christianised by the anonymous scribe who composed it.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Anonymous: Beowulf In this tutorial, students will read the Old English epic poem Beowulf , the only surviving manuscript of which was thought to have been composed between c. 975-1025 CE. Attention will be paid to the way that this pagan oral narrative was Christianised by the anonymous scribe who composed it.

learning_activities.topic:
Heaven, Hell & Purgatory

This lecture will examine the historical development of Heaven, Hell and Purgatory from Late Antiquity to the High Middle Ages.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Heaven, Hell & Purgatory This lecture will examine the historical development of Heaven, Hell and Purgatory from Late Antiquity to the High Middle Ages.

learning_activities.topic:
Dante: Inferno

In this tutorial, students will read the first part of Dante's Divina Commedia, the Inferno, the journey of Dante and his guide Virgil through the nine levels of Hell, and discuss its themes as well as its context and later importance.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Dante: Inferno In this tutorial, students will read the first part of Dante's Divina Commedia , the Inferno , the journey of Dante and his guide Virgil through the nine levels of Hell, and discuss its themes as well as its context and later importance.

learning_activities.topic:
Medieval Eve

This lecture will explore the place of women in European society during the Middle Ages, the types of religious misogyny they faced, as well as some early responses to antifeminism.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Medieval Eve This lecture will explore the place of women in European society during the Middle Ages, the types of religious misogyny they faced, as well as some early responses to antifeminism.

learning_activities.topic:
Pizan: The Book of the City of Ladies

In this tutorial, students will read Christine de Pizan’s 1405 defence of women’s contribution to Western culture through her literary construction of an allegorical city.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Pizan: The Book of the City of Ladies
learning_activities.topic_description: Pizan: The Book of the City of Ladies In this tutorial, students will read Christine de Pizan’s 1405 defence of women’s contribution to Western culture through her literary construction of an allegorical city.

learning_activities.topic:
The Renaissance

This lecture will explore the fortunes of Christianity in the Renaissance, including the emergence of criticism of the Roman Catholic Church from John Wycliffe, Jan Hus, and the movement known as the Devotio moderna.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The Renaissance This lecture will explore the fortunes of Christianity in the Renaissance, including the emergence of criticism of the Roman Catholic Church from John Wycliffe, Jan Hus, and the movement known as the Devotio moderna .

learning_activities.topic:
Erasmus: In Praise of Folly

In this tutorial, students will read the work that anticipated Luther’s Ninety-Five Theses (1517) and the start of the Reformation, Erasmus’s In Praise of Folly, and discuss its method and critique of late medieval and Renaissance culture.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Erasmus: In Praise of Folly In this tutorial, students will read the work that anticipated Luther’s Ninety-Five Theses (1517) and the start of the Reformation, Erasmus’s In Praise of Folly , and discuss its method and critique of late medieval and Renaissance culture.

learning_activities.topic:
Protestantism

This lecture will explore the theology and impact of reformer Martin Luther, as well as the early spread of Protestantism in Germany and Switzerland.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Protestantism This lecture will explore the theology and impact of reformer Martin Luther, as well as the early spread of Protestantism in Germany and Switzerland.

learning_activities.topic:
Milton: Paradise Lost (Part 1)

In this tutorial, students will read books I-VI of Milton’s Paradise Lost (1667), an epic poem that retells the biblical fall of Adam and Eve in light of God’s war against Satan.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Milton: Paradise Lost (Part 1) In this tutorial, students will read books I-VI of Milton’s Paradise Lost (1667), an epic poem that retells the biblical fall of Adam and Eve in light of God’s war against Satan.

learning_activities.topic:
The English Reformation

This lecture will chronicle the history of the Reformation in England from the 1520s to 1660s, with a particular focus on the influence of Calvinism.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The English Reformation This lecture will chronicle the history of the Reformation in England from the 1520s to 1660s, with a particular focus on the influence of Calvinism.

learning_activities.topic:
Milton: Paradise Lost (Part 2)

In this tutorial, students will read books VII-XII of Milton’s Paradise Lost (1667), an epic poem that retells the biblical fall of Adam and Eve in light of God’s war against Satan.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Milton: Paradise Lost (Part 2) In this tutorial, students will read books VII-XII of Milton’s Paradise Lost (1667), an epic poem that retells the biblical fall of Adam and Eve in light of God’s war against Satan.

learning_activities.topic: Mid-Semester Break
learning_activities.topic_description: Mid-Semester Break

learning_activities.topic:
Course Reading Week

There will be no lecture or tutorials this week in WCIV1100.
learning_activities.topic_description: Course Reading Week There will be no lecture or tutorials this week in WCIV1100.

learning_activities.topic:
The Soul

This lecture will examine debates about the soul, paying particular attention to the role that the newly discovered force of electricity acquired in religious debates of the 18th and 19th centuries.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: The Soul This lecture will examine debates about the soul, paying particular attention to the role that the newly discovered force of electricity acquired in religious debates of the 18th and 19th centuries.

learning_activities.topic:
Shelley: Frankenstein

In this tutorial, students will read Mary Shelley’s story of the young Victor Frankenstein’s creation and its repercussions in Frankenstein, and discuss the importance of Jewish and Christian themes to secular literature and culture.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Shelley: Frankenstein In this tutorial, students will read Mary Shelley’s story of the young Victor Frankenstein’s creation and its repercussions in Frankenstein , and discuss the importance of Jewish and Christian themes to secular literature and culture.

learning_activities.topic:
The Holocaust

This lecture will explore the history of antisemitism in the West, the rise of Nazism, and the Holocaust (1941-1945).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: The Holocaust This lecture will explore the history of antisemitism in the West, the rise of Nazism, and the Holocaust (1941-1945).

learning_activities.topic:
Levi: If This is a Man

In this tutorial, students will read Primo Levi's recollection of his time in the Auschwitz concentration camp, and discuss the Holocaust's significance for Judaism and the role of God in the face of unspeakable acts of evil.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Levi: If This is a Man In this tutorial, students will read Primo Levi's recollection of his time in the Auschwitz concentration camp, and discuss the Holocaust's significance for Judaism and the role of God in the face of unspeakable acts of evil.

learning_activities.topic:
The Death of God

This lecture will explore Nietzsche’s claim that 'God is dead', followed by an exploration of existentialism and Christianity’s response to it.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: The Death of God This lecture will explore Nietzsche’s claim that 'God is dead', followed by an exploration of existentialism and Christianity’s response to it.

learning_activities.topic:
Tillich: The Courage To Be

In this tutorial, students will read Lutheran theologian Paul Tillich’s 1952 classic The Courage to Be, a response to the existential anxiety experienced in the wake of the world wars.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Tillich: The Courage To Be In this tutorial, students will read Lutheran theologian Paul Tillich’s 1952 classic The Courage to Be , a response to the existential anxiety experienced in the wake of the world wars.
